#  Plan Your Visit 

[GET TICKETS](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/holocaust-center-for-humanity-exhibit-finding-light-in-the-darkness-tickets-1363530599729?aff=ebdssbdestsearch)

**_"The first moment I stepped into the door, I was in awe." - Visitor_**

# **Art is Resistance**

### February 1 - March 15, 2026

During the Holocaust, many artists used their talents and their artwork to protest Nazi oppression. They documented the suffering around them, incorporated forbidden symbols, and asserted their own humanity when the world around them was determined to strip it away.

**Art has never been silent.** In the face of injustice, in the face of dehumanization, art is a bold statement. **Art resists.**

Art is Resistance brings together works submitted by Washington State artists* that stand as testaments to courage, memory, and connection. In a time of growing division, art encourages us to recognize the humanity in one another, across cultures, identities, and experiences. 

The purpose of this show is not only to highlight resistance, but to invite empathy and create space for shared reflection, where art becomes a bridge across differences. Now more than ever, we need reminders of our shared humanity and the power of standing together in the face of fear and fragmentation. Art offers us that opportunity. It allows us to gather, to contemplate, to imagine, and to care. Art is connection. **Art is Resistance.**
